meanings.definition: Study again in order to review or improve knowledge.
meanings.sent1: I need to restudy the math problems to understand them better.
meanings.sent2: She decided to restudy the history notes before the exam.
meanings.sent3: Let's restudy the science facts so we can impress our teacher.
meanings.sent4: Restudying the map of the city is like rediscovering hidden treasures.
meanings.sent5: Restudy the vocabulary words until they stick in your memory.

meanings.definition: To go over material previously studied.
meanings.sent1: After class, I will restudy the notes to remember the key points.
meanings.sent2: He likes to restudy his favorite books to find new details.
meanings.sent3: Restudy the recipe to make sure we don't forget any ingredients.
meanings.sent4: Restudying the map is like retracing our steps through the city.
meanings.sent5: It's important to restudy the rules before taking the test.

meanings.definition: To review or revisit information for better understanding.
meanings.sent1: I will restudy the instructions to complete the project correctly.
meanings.sent2: They decided to restudy the data to find any errors.
meanings.sent3: Let's restudy the song lyrics to sing along perfectly.
meanings.sent4: Restudying the painting reveals new details we missed before.
meanings.sent5: Restudy the map to navigate through the city with ease.
